docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct, 12. -- A gross profit of $6,608,376.73 was made by Dillon, Read  Co. and their syndicate associates in the flotation of four Brazilian and Bolivian Government bond issues totaling $130,500,000, now in default, the Senate subcommittee...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct, 12. -- A gross profit of $6,608,376.73 was made by Dillon, Read Co. and their syndicate associates in the flotation of four Brazilian and Bolivian Government bond issues totaling $130,500,000, now in default, the Senate subcommittee investigating Stock Exchange practices was informed today by Robert Otis Hayward, a vice president of the firm.
docs.abstract: Says Dillon, Read & Co concealed tech default from bondholders of Brazilian issue floated by firm

headline.main: DILLON GROUP MADE 6 MILLION ON LOANS; Brazilian and Bolivian Bonds Totaling $130,000,000 Now in Default.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 12. -- Sitting in public today the Council of the League of Nations decided to invite the United States to participate in an autonomous governing body that it is creating for the relief of German refugees.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 12. -- Sitting in public today the Council of the League of Nations decided to invite the United States to participate in an autonomous governing body that it is creating for the relief of German refugees.
docs.abstract: League Council invites U S to participate in autonomous body created for relief of refugees; several mentioned for post of Comr

headline.main: LEAGUE INVITES US INTO REFUGEE BODY; Council Asks United States to Be One of 15 Nations Aiding Commissioner for Germans.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 12 (Canadian Press). -- Cheering trade reports came from different quarters today. Production of steel ingots and castings in September was announced as 238,700 tons larger than in the same month last year, and Prince George, opening the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 12 (Canadian Press). -- Cheering trade reports came from different quarters today. Production of steel ingots and castings in September was announced as 238,700 tons larger than in the same month last year, and Prince George, opening the motor show at the Olympia, pointed to an increase of 27 per cent in domestic production and of 68 per cent in motor production for foreign trade.
docs.abstract: Plans for negotiations with Uruguay, Poland, Spain and Italy

headline.main: Britain, Reporting Business Gains, Plans To Expand Her Foreign Cotton Trade

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 -- A loan of $300,000 by Dillon, Read  Co. of New York to Harvey C. Couch, before he became a director of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, was disclosed today at the Senate stock market inquiry.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 -- A loan of $300,000 by Dillon, Read Co. of New York to Harvey C. Couch, before he became a director of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, was disclosed today at the Senate stock market inquiry.
docs.abstract: Revealed at Sen Banking and Currency Com inquiry into Dillon, Read & Co as recipient of loan and participant in La & Ark Ry stock pool

headline.main: DILLON LOAN LIST NAMES H.C. COUCH; $300,000 Borrowed From Bankers 4 Years Before He Became Director of RFC. PARTNER CUT INCOME TAX Forrestal Escaped $95,000 in 1929 -- Firm's Profits $23,- 835,197 in Five Years. DILLON LOAN LIST NAMES H.C. COUCH

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Oct. 13. -- The development of the Cuban situation as a Cuban problem being solved by Cuban methods without American intervention is highly gratifying to American official circles here.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Oct. 13. -- The development of the Cuban situation as a Cuban problem being solved by Cuban methods without American intervention is highly gratifying to American official circles here.
docs.abstract: Non-intervention of U S in Cuba favorably effects plans

headline.main: Non-Intervention in Cuba Aids Pan-American Amity; Favorably Affects Parley and Negotiation of Pacts -- Our Relations With Lands to South Better Than in Long Time.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: PAN-AMER CONF (INTERNATL CONF OF AMER STATES)

docs.snippet: To the Editor of The New York Times: In view of the importance of the Seventh International Conference of American States, commonly known as the Seventh Pan-American Conference, which will be held at Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay, in December,...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of The New York Times: In view of the importance of the Seventh International Conference of American States, commonly known as the Seventh Pan-American Conference, which will be held at Montevideo, the capital of Uruguay, in December, it is to be hoped that a few comments on that great gathering may be appropriate at this time.

headline.main: POTENTIALITIES SEEN IN COMING MEETING; Seventh Pan-American Conference at Montevideo in December Might Accomplish Much

docs.snippet: The American dollar was strong last week. Based on the French franc quotation, the dollar soared to 69.82 cents on Saturday, highest in one month. From the low of the week, 65.85, reached on Monday, to the top of 69.82, there was a gross gain of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The American dollar was strong last week. Based on the French franc quotation, the dollar soared to 69.82 cents on Saturday, highest in one month. From the low of the week, 65.85, reached on Monday, to the top of 69.82, there was a gross gain of slightly less than 4 cents. Range a year ago was 99.98@99.63 cents.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES WEEK ENDED OCT. 14, 1933.
